GLOOMY.Definition: dark or sad in appearance or atmosphere

LACK.Definition: the fact that there wasn't any

GROUND TO A HALT.Definition: completely stopped or ceased to progress

IN STORE.Definition: planned or likely to happen in the future

DISPELLED.Definition: made to disappear or go away

PALED IN COMPARISON.Definition: were much less impressive or significant

CREDULOUS.Definition: easily believing things without questioning or examining them

COINED.Definition: created or invented (a new word or phrase)

POIGNANT.Definition: causing a sense of sadness or regret

TREADING WATER.Definition: keeping a position or situation without making progress

DEROGATORY.Definition: showing a critical or disrespectful attitude

DEFERRED TO.Definition: allowed it to decide or choose for them

SUPERSTITION.Definition: belief or notion that is based on irrational or supernatural causes rather than reason or evidence

INCIDENTALLY.Definition: by the way, as a side note

POWER VACUUM.Definition: situation where there was no established leadership or authority

TRIBES.Definition: groups of people who were connected by a common culture, tradition, or ancestry

MENTAL BANDWIDTH.Definition: mental capacity or ability to handle or process information

STEREOTYPES.Definition: widely held but oversimplified ideas or beliefs

TORN APART.Definition: killed in a very violent way

PAPACY.Definition: the office or position of the Pope, the head of the Roman Catholic Church

MONASTIC ORDERS.Definition: religious communities of monks or nuns

SUBSISTENCE.Definition: form of farming whose products were intended to provide for the basic needs of the farmer, with little left for marketing

PLOUGHING.Definition: the act of turning over soil with a plough or similar tools

DYNASTIES.Definition: families or rulers who were from the same family and held power

SUPPOSED.Definition: assumed or believed to be true, but not proven or confirmed

COINING.Definition: inventing or creating (a new word or phrase)

CAST THE TERM ASIDE.Definition: rejected or dismissed the use of the term

SUPERIORITY.Definition: the state of being better, greater, or more important than others

STAGNATION.Definition: situation in which there was no growth, development, or progress
